intro: Saguaster pickeringii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has dark green, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Saguaster pickeringii is adapted to harsh, dry environments and has a deep root system to access water. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
